body.p: Simal is a tool for building and tracking projects and the people involved in those projects. Simal is very young at this time. As such, we welcome input into the requirements and design of the initial prototype system.

section.title: Quick Start
section.p: This site provides a small project catalogue as an example of Simal can do. The catalogue is generated from RDF documents maintained and hosted by the projects themselves or, where no such document exists, by the Simal project. View the catalogue by clicking on the catalogue link above, or by using our AJAX powered browser.
Want to get at the code? The impatient may like our quick start documentation.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Simal is an open source framework for building systems for use by those who need to inform a community about the activities of multiple projects that may be hosted in multiple locations. Each project maintains an entry within the Simal project catalogue by means of an RDF/XML file. This entry contains a description of what the project is doing, team members, community structure, deliverables, etc. Simal uses this file to gather a range of information about the projects and presents it in various forms to suit a variety of uses, such as a web site, or PDF document.

Simal also provides a web application for the creation and management of catalogues built using this system. This application allows users to identity projects of interest to their community and generate customised catalogues for their own use, within their own projects website.

The generated catalogues present a useful community development and support tool. They enable users to quickly and easily track activity in multiple related projects from a single location. Thus a projects outputs are visible beyond its immediate community. By exposing relevant outputs to a wider community we hope to increase the level of interaction between related projects.
The project is very young at this time. As such, we welcome input into the requirements and design of the initial prototype system.

section.title: Project Catalogue
section.p: The project catalogue is built by importing Description of a Project (DOAP) files from projects. Once made available to the system these DOAP files are aggregated and presented in various ways that allow a catalogue of projects to be presented and manipulated. This catalogue can be used to find relationships (either existing or potential) between projects.

section.title: Status
section.p: The catalogue is currently in an early prototype stage. To view the current catalogue functionality follow the links in the catalogue menu on the left. For more information about the current status and recent changes in the catalogue code see the recent changes document (you can subscribe to a changes RSS feed if you prefer).

In order to move forward with the development of the catalogue we need to increase the number of projects represented with DOAP files, and we need to extend the information stored in current projects files.

section.title: Community Support
section.p: The community support systems allow individuals or groups to manage public and private information concerning the communties that develop around open source projects. The application allows project managers and developers to effortlessly inform their communities about changes in the project make-up and community tools. There is also a set of tools for identifying potential collaboration points between communities.

section.title: Status
section.p: The community support features are still in an early stage of planning. We welcome contributions to the initial requirements gathering processes.

section.title: Contributing
section.p: Simal is an open source project that adopts an open development methodology. We welcome contributions from anyone, such contributions may include (but are not limited to):

ul.li: User feedback such as bug reports and feature requests
User support such as documentation and mailing list participation
Patches addressing bugs or adding new features
